reasoning: Aggregate incidence of primary CNS neoplasms (malignant and benign) estimated at ~7.5 per 100k globally. Umbrella term covering gliomas, meningiomas, pituitary adenomas, and other brain/spinal cord tumors with different epidemiologies. Confidence limited by heterogeneous composition and significant geographic variation.
source: GLOBOCAN 2005 (IARC) - Primary brain and CNS malignancies
